newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's BCH 9-mth profit rises 20.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: Spain's BCH 9-mth profit rises 20.1 pct.

text.p: Central Hispano Group nine months to end September results versus year-earlier period, in billions of pesetas unless stated.

NOTE - BCH said total assets at September totalled 11.47 trillion pesetas, up 14.4 percent year-on-year. Total lending rose 18.0 percent and customer funds were up 12.8 percent in the same period. Liquidity at the same date amounted to 1 trillion pesetas.
1996 net profit is still estimated to be "practically treble" 1995 figures, BCH said.
The bank said its ongoing strategy to increase productivity and rationalise structure was reflected in lower personnel costs and a 10 percent reduction in general expenses.
Non-performing loans account for 4.1 percent of total loans, and coverage of bad debts is above 115 percent, it added.
BCH also said it would pay an interim dividend of 50 pesetas a share gross, and a final dividend of 50 pesetas or more.
